parameters.name: StreamingDistributionConfig
parameters.description: The streaming distribution's configuration information. A unique value (for example, a date-time stamp) that ensures that the request can't be replayed. If the value of CallerReference is new (regardless of the content of the StreamingDistributionConfig object), CloudFront creates a new distribution. If CallerReference is a value that you already sent in a previous request to create a distribution, CloudFront returns a DistributionAlreadyExists error. A complex type that contains information about the Amazon S3 bucket from which you want CloudFront to get your media files for distribution. The DNS name of the Amazon S3 origin. The CloudFront origin access identity to associate with the distribution. Use an origin access identity to configure the distribution so that end users can only access objects in an Amazon S3 bucket through CloudFront. If you want end users to be able to access objects using either the CloudFront URL or the Amazon S3 URL, specify an empty OriginAccessIdentity element. To delete the origin access identity from an existing distribution, update the distribution configuration and include an empty OriginAccessIdentity element. To replace the origin access identity, update the distribution configuration and specify the new origin access identity. For more information, see Using an Origin Access Identity to Restrict Access to Your Amazon S3 Content in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide. Aliases (dict) --- A complex type that contains information about CNAMEs (alternate domain names), if any, for this streaming distribution. The number of CNAME aliases, if any, that you want to associate with this distribution. Items (list) --- A complex type that contains the CNAME aliases, if any, that you want to associate with this distribution. (string) --- Any comments you want to include about the streaming distribution. Logging (dict) --- A complex type that controls whether access logs are written for the streaming distribution. Specifies whether you want CloudFront to save access logs to an Amazon S3 bucket. If you don't want to enable logging when you create a streaming distribution or if you want to disable logging for an existing streaming distribution, specify false for Enabled, and specify empty Bucket and Prefix elements. If you specify false for Enabled but you specify values for Bucket and Prefix, the values are automatically deleted. The Amazon S3 bucket to store the access logs in, for example, amzn-s3-demo-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com. An optional string that you want CloudFront to prefix to the access log filenames for this streaming distribution, for example, myprefix/. If you want to enable logging, but you don't want to specify a prefix, you still must include an empty Prefix element in the Logging element. A complex type that specifies any Amazon Web Services accounts that you want to permit to create signed URLs for private content. If you want the distribution to use signed URLs, include this element; if you want the distribution to use public URLs, remove this element. For more information, see Serving Private Content through CloudFront in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide. This field is true if any of the Amazon Web Services accounts in the list are configured as trusted signers. If not, this field is false. The number of Amazon Web Services accounts in the list. Items (list) --- A list of Amazon Web Services account identifiers. (string) --- PriceClass (string) --- A complex type that contains information about price class for this streaming distribution. Whether the streaming distribution is enabled to accept user requests for content.

nested_params.name: CallerReference
nested_params.description: A unique value (for example, a date-time stamp) that ensures that the request can't be replayed. If the value of CallerReference is new (regardless of the content of the StreamingDistributionConfig object), CloudFront creates a new distribution. If CallerReference is a value that you already sent in a previous request to create a distribution, CloudFront returns a DistributionAlreadyExists error.

nested_params.name: S3Origin
nested_params.description: A complex type that contains information about the Amazon S3 bucket from which you want CloudFront to get your media files for distribution.

nested_params.name: DomainName
nested_params.description: The DNS name of the Amazon S3 origin.

nested_params.name: OriginAccessIdentity
nested_params.description: The CloudFront origin access identity to associate with the distribution. Use an origin access identity to configure the distribution so that end users can only access objects in an Amazon S3 bucket through CloudFront. If you want end users to be able to access objects using either the CloudFront URL or the Amazon S3 URL, specify an empty OriginAccessIdentity element. To delete the origin access identity from an existing distribution, update the distribution configuration and include an empty OriginAccessIdentity element. To replace the origin access identity, update the distribution configuration and specify the new origin access identity. For more information, see Using an Origin Access Identity to Restrict Access to Your Amazon S3 Content in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: Aliases
nested_params.description: A complex type that contains information about CNAMEs (alternate domain names), if any, for this streaming distribution.

nested_params.name: Quantity
nested_params.description: The number of CNAME aliases, if any, that you want to associate with this distribution.

nested_params.name: Items
nested_params.description: A complex type that contains the CNAME aliases, if any, that you want to associate with this distribution.

nested_params.name: Comment
nested_params.description: Any comments you want to include about the streaming distribution.

nested_params.name: Logging
nested_params.description: A complex type that controls whether access logs are written for the streaming distribution.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Specifies whether you want CloudFront to save access logs to an Amazon S3 bucket. If you don't want to enable logging when you create a streaming distribution or if you want to disable logging for an existing streaming distribution, specify false for Enabled, and specify empty Bucket and Prefix elements. If you specify false for Enabled but you specify values for Bucket and Prefix, the values are automatically deleted.

nested_params.name: Bucket
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket to store the access logs in, for example, amzn-s3-demo-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com.

nested_params.name: Prefix
nested_params.description: An optional string that you want CloudFront to prefix to the access log filenames for this streaming distribution, for example, myprefix/. If you want to enable logging, but you don't want to specify a prefix, you still must include an empty Prefix element in the Logging element.

nested_params.name: TrustedSigners
nested_params.description: A complex type that specifies any Amazon Web Services accounts that you want to permit to create signed URLs for private content. If you want the distribution to use signed URLs, include this element; if you want the distribution to use public URLs, remove this element. For more information, see Serving Private Content through CloudFront in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: This field is true if any of the Amazon Web Services accounts in the list are configured as trusted signers. If not, this field is false.

nested_params.name: Quantity
nested_params.description: The number of Amazon Web Services accounts in the list.

nested_params.name: Items
nested_params.description: A list of Amazon Web Services account identifiers.

nested_params.name: PriceClass
nested_params.description: A complex type that contains information about price class for this streaming distribution.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Whether the streaming distribution is enabled to accept user requests for content.

nested_items.name: StreamingDistribution
nested_items.description: The streaming distribution's information.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier for the RTMP distribution. For example: EGTXBD79EXAMPLE.

nested_items.name: ARN
nested_items.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) for the distribution. For example: arn:aws:cloudfront::123456789012:distribution/EDFDVBD632BHDS5, where 123456789012 is your Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the RTMP distribution. When the status is Deployed, the distribution's information is propagated to all CloudFront edge locations.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the distribution was last modified.

nested_items.name: DomainName
nested_items.description: The domain name that corresponds to the streaming distribution, for example, s5c39gqb8ow64r.cloudfront.net.

nested_items.name: ActiveTrustedSigners
nested_items.description: A complex type that lists the Amazon Web Services accounts, if any, that you included in the TrustedSigners complex type for this distribution. These are the accounts that you want to allow to create signed URLs for private content.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: This field is true if any of the Amazon Web Services accounts in the list are configured as trusted signers. If not, this field is false.

nested_items.name: Quantity
nested_items.description: The number of Amazon Web Services accounts in the list.

nested_items.name: Items
nested_items.description: A list of Amazon Web Services accounts and the identifiers of active CloudFront key pairs in each account that CloudFront can use to verify the signatures of signed URLs and signed cookies.

nested_items.name: AwsAccountNumber
nested_items.description: An Amazon Web Services account number that contains active CloudFront key pairs that CloudFront can use to verify the signatures of signed URLs and signed cookies. If the Amazon Web Services account that owns the key pairs is the same account that owns the CloudFront distribution, the value of this field is self.

nested_items.name: KeyPairIds
nested_items.description: A list of CloudFront key pair identifiers.

nested_items.name: Quantity
nested_items.description: The number of key pair identifiers in the list.

nested_items.name: Items
nested_items.description: A list of CloudFront key pair identifiers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StreamingDistributionConfig
nested_items.description: The current configuration information for the RTMP distribution.

nested_items.name: CallerReference
nested_items.description: A unique value (for example, a date-time stamp) that ensures that the request can't be replayed.

nested_items.name: DomainName
nested_items.description: The DNS name of the Amazon S3 origin.

nested_items.name: OriginAccessIdentity
nested_items.description: The CloudFront origin access identity to associate with the distribution. Use an origin access identity to configure the distribution so that end users can only access objects in an Amazon S3 bucket through CloudFront.

nested_items.name: Quantity
nested_items.description: The number of CNAME aliases, if any, that you want to associate with this distribution.

nested_items.name: Items
nested_items.description: A complex type that contains the CNAME aliases, if any, that you want to associate with this distribution.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether you want CloudFront to save access logs to an Amazon S3 bucket. If you don't want to enable logging when you create a streaming distribution or if you want to disable logging for an existing streaming distribution, specify false for Enabled, and specify empty Bucket and Prefix elements. If you specify false for Enabled but you specify values for Bucket and Prefix, the values are automatically deleted.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket to store the access logs in, for example, amzn-s3-demo-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: An optional string that you want CloudFront to prefix to the access log filenames for this streaming distribution, for example, myprefix/. If you want to enable logging, but you don't want to specify a prefix, you still must include an empty Prefix element in the Logging element.

nested_items.name: TrustedSigners
nested_items.description: A complex type that specifies any Amazon Web Services accounts that you want to permit to create signed URLs for private content. If you want the distribution to use signed URLs, include this element; if you want the distribution to use public URLs, remove this element. For more information, see Serving Private Content through CloudFront in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: This field is true if any of the Amazon Web Services accounts in the list are configured as trusted signers. If not, this field is false.

nested_items.name: Quantity
nested_items.description: The number of Amazon Web Services accounts in the list.

nested_items.name: Items
nested_items.description: A list of Amazon Web Services account identifiers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PriceClass
nested_items.description: A complex type that contains information about price class for this streaming distribution.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Whether the streaming distribution is enabled to accept user requests for content.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The current version of the configuration. For example: E2QWRUHAPOMQZL.
